meanings.definition: Make (someone) familiar with or accustomed to something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher familiarises the students with the new math concepts.
meanings.sent2: She familiarises herself with the neighborhood by taking walks every evening.
meanings.sent3: The cat familiarises itself with the new toy by playing with it all day.
meanings.sent4: Practice familiarises the musician's fingers with the piano keys.
meanings.sent5: Repetition familiarises the mind with important information.

meanings.definition: Become well known with or used to something.
meanings.sent1: Over time, she familiarises herself with the local customs.
meanings.sent2: The child familiarises quickly with the rules of the game.
meanings.sent3: The robot familiarises with the daily routine and starts helping around the house.
meanings.sent4: The melody familiarises itself in your mind and you find yourself humming it all day.
meanings.sent5: Experience familiarises you with different cultures and traditions.
